properties.Name: Brother Nature
properties.Description: Greg and Olivia grow delicious salad for their CSA and raise free range chickens and ducks

properties.Name: Plum Street Market Garden
properties.Description: The Plum St. Garden is part of “keep growing Detroit” they grow vegetables to sell at market and also supply the seedlings for the “garden resource program.”

properties.Name: Food Field
properties.Description: Food Field is a fully functional CSA that also sells to markets. They farm about four acres.
Earthworks is an extension of the Capuchin soup kitchen that seeks to to build a just food system through education, inspiration, and community development
properties.Name: Earthworks Urban Farm
Chris McGrane's Farm
properties.Description: This farm part of the “city commons CSA” which is a cooperative urban CSA

properties.Name: Singing Tree Farms
properties.Description: Singing Tree farm is also a part of the “City commons CSA” They grow vegetables, raise chickens, and also sell art through the CSA

properties.Name: D-Town Farms
properties.Description: D-Town Farms is a 7 acre farm located in Rouge River Park. D-Town is a part of Detroit Black Community Food Security Network.

properties.Name: Hamtown Farms
properties.Description: Hamtown Farms is an orchard of Pawpaw and Cherry trees, along with a small community garden.

properties.Name: Burnside CSA
properties.Description: Burnside is a fully functional CSA on about an acre of vacant property North of Hamtramck

properties.Name: Brightmoor Youth Garden
properties.Description: Brightmoor Youth Garden seeks to use market gardening as a vehicle to provide youth, ages 9-18, with the opportunity to obtain and build skills, knowledge and experience necessary for a healthy, prosperous, purposeful, and sustainable life.

properties.Name: St Aubin Community Garden
properties.Description: A three lot community garden in 3c neighborhood of Hamtramck

properties.Name: Pingree Farms
properties.Description: Pingree Farms is large market garden in highland park. They also have cattle and emus

properties.Name: Michigan Urban Farming Initiative
properties.Description: ﻿​Using agriculture as a platform to promote education, community, and sustainability, we seek to reduce socioeconomic disparity.

properties.Name: Russel Street Deli Garden
properties.Description: This garden is maintained by the Russel Street Deli. All the produce goes on the menu.

properties.Name: Detroit Market Garden
properties.Description: This two acre urban farm is a project of "The Greening of Detroit."

properties.Name: Catherine Ferguson Academy Urban Farm
properties.Description: An urban farm that is part of the academy. They have ducks. rabbits. chickens and vegetable gardens.

properties.Name: Lafayette Greens
properties.Description: Built on the former site of the historic Lafayette Building, Lafayette Greens is a nearly half-acre garden space in the downtown district of Detroit. With 35 raised beds, fruit trees, a children's garden and more

properties.Name: North Cass community Garden
properties.Description: A large community garden that rents plots to neighbors and restaurants.

properties.Name: Farnsworth Community Garden
properties.Description: A vibrant garden maintained by the residents of the neighborhood.

properties.Name: Andrew Kemp's Farm/Homestead
properties.Description: Kemp grows all kinds of veggies and has many fruit trees as well. He farms about three acres

properties.Name: Rising Pheasant Farm
properties.Description: A family-owned farm on Detroit's Eastside. We specialize in naturally-grown microgreens and a wide variety of heirloom vegetable crops all delivered to local markets and restaurants by bicycle!

properties.Name: Hamtramck Zen Garden
properties.Description: This is a Zen garden for meditation and relaxation. It is maintained by the Hamtramck Zen center.

properties.Name: Spirit of Hope Urban Farm
properties.Description: Spirit of Hope is an urban farm that helps stock the churches Food Pantry, their volunteers, and neighbors.

properties.Name: Freedom Freedom Growers
properties.Description: Feedom-Freedom Growers is a community group and resource committed to growing community relationships through the cultivation of food, hearts and minds.

properties.Name: Georgia Street Community Garden
properties.Description: This community garden is a part of the Georgia Street Community Collective that is seeking to rebuild and sustain their neighborhood.

properties.Name: Chiwara Permaculture
properties.Description: Chiwara has established the first urban permaculture research and education facility in the city, known as Chiwara HP.
